CIS: CIS stands for 'cislocative.' The cislocative indicates direction towards a point of reference with verbs that involve motion in a certain direction.
COIN: COIN stands for 'coincident.' The coincident is used to indicate simultaneous occurrence (i.e. event takes place at the same time as another event) in contexts in which the focus is on the time of the action.
1SG.P: 1SG.P stands for 'first-singular patient. It is a pronominal prefix that refers to the speaker.
STAT: STAT stands for 'stative.' The stative aspect describes states. The state may be an inherent condition or it may be the result of an earlier action.
